page.title: 04PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content:
Collingbourne Primary School
The Marquess of Ailesbury supplied the money for the school to be built in 1862.When the school originally opened it was built for 110 pupils,though not that many attended.The first headmaster had to leave in 1869 because he didn't play the organ on Sundays.The children left school permanently at the age of 12.Some children left temporarily to help on the farm or at home.Some of the older children stayed after school to learn the lessons for the next day,so that they could help teach.They were called pupil teachers.The children started school at the age of 5 years old.When the school opened there was only one teacher.
